net.varkhan.base.containers.array
Class Arrays

java.lang.Object
  net.varkhan.base.containers.array.Arrays

public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object

Static array manipulation utilities.

Utilities for converting primitive type arrays to human-readable strings, accessing, comparing and sorting array elements.

Method Detail

equals

public static <T> boolean equals(T[] array1,
                                 T[] array2)
Indicates whether two byte arrays are equal.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
array1 - the first array
array2 - the second array
Returns:
true iff the arrays are either both null or have the same number of elements, and the values of elements in the same positions are equal

indexOf

public static <T> int indexOf(T item,
                              T... array)
Returns the position of the first occurrence of an object inside an array.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
item - the object to search for
array - the array to search
Returns:
-1 if item was not found in array, the position of the first element of the array for which item.equals() is true.

indexOf

public static <T> int indexOf(T[] array,
                              int pos,
                              T[] sub)
Returns the position of the first occurrence of an array as a subsequence of an other array.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
array - the array
pos - the starting point in the array
sub - the subsequence to find
Returns:
the smallest index idx greater than pos such that the elements of array starting at idx are exactly those of sub (-1 is returned if sub is not a subsequence of array)

Type Parameters:

Parameters:
ary - the array to sort
Returns:
the number of swap operations required for the sorting

search

public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> int search(T[] ary,
                                                                     int inf,
                                                                     int sup,
                                                                     T key)
Finds an object in a sorted array, using the natural order.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
ary - the sorted array
inf - the minimum index
sup - the maximum index
key - the object to search for
Returns:
the key position in the array, or -(inspos+1), where inspos is the index of the first object in the array bigger than key

union

public static <T> T[] union(T[] ary1,
                            int beg1,
                            int len1,
                            T[] ary2,
                            int beg2,
                            int len2,
                            java.util.Comparator<? super T> comp)
Computes the union of segments in two sorted arrays, using a comparator.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
ary1 - the first sorted array
beg1 - the start position of the first segment
len1 - the length of the first segment
ary2 - the second sorted array
beg2 - the start position of the second segment
len2 - the length of the second segment
comp - the comparator
Returns:
the union of the two segments, with duplicates removed

append

public static <T> T[] append(T[] array,
                             T... elems)
Append elements to an array.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
array - the array to append to
elems - the elements to append
Returns:
an array containing all the elements of array followed by all the elements in elems

prepend

public static <T> T[] prepend(T[] array,
                              T... elems)
Prepend elements to an array.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
array - the array to prepend to
elems - the elements to prepend
Returns:
an array containing all the elements in elems followed by all the elements of array

concat

public static <T> T[] concat(T[] array,
                             T[]... arrays)
Concatenates several arrays.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
array - the first array to append to
arrays - the arrays to append
Returns:
an array whose element type is the element type of the first array, and containing all the elements in the arrays, in order

subarray

public static <T> T[] subarray(T[] array,
                               int beg,
                               int end)
Returns a segment of an array.

Type Parameters:
T - the element type
Parameters:
array - the source array
beg - the beginning position of the segment, inclusive
end - the ending position of the segment, exclusive
Returns:
an array whose element type is the element type of the input array, of length end-beg, and containing all the elements between positions beg, inclusive, and end, exclusive, of the original array

asList

public static <T> List<T> asList(T... values)
Returns an immutable list backed by an array.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the values
Parameters:
values - the array of values
Returns:
a list holding the elements of the array, in order

asMap

public static <K,V> Map<K,V> asMap(java.lang.Class<K> kclass,
                                   java.lang.Class<V> vclass,
                                   java.lang.Object... values)
Returns an array of alternating keys and values as a map.

Type Parameters:
K - the type of the keys
V - the type of the values
Parameters:
kclass - the class of the keys
vclass - the class of the values
values - the array of keys and values
Returns:
a map associating the object at even indexes in the array to the immediately following (odd index) element
